what-it-does: Checks for enum classes which are also decorated with @dataclass.
why-is-this-bad:
Decorating an enum with @dataclass() does not cause any errors at runtime,
but may cause erroneous results:


@dataclass
class E(Enum):
    A = 1
    B = 2

print(E.A == E.B)  # True
example:
from dataclasses import dataclass
from enum import Enum


@dataclass
class E(Enum): ...



Use instead:


from enum import Enum


class E(Enum): ...

example-split.example-before:
from dataclasses import dataclass
from enum import Enum


@dataclass
class E(Enum): ...
